Questions.Text: Imagine you are in a meeting with the CEO discussing the initial rollout of the e-commerce platform. The CEO asks how you plan to handle customer feedback during this phase. Which of the following approaches would you recommend?
Options: A) Launch the platform and gather feedback passively without direct interaction.
B) Actively engage with customers through surveys, focus groups, and support channels to gather feedback and make iterative improvements.
C) Ignore customer feedback until the full platform is launched.
D) Implement all feedback immediately without considering feasibility or impact.

Questions.Text: The CEO is concerned about the security of the payment processing system. Which of the following measures would you recommend to ensure secure transactions?
Options: A) Use a third-party payment gateway like Braintree with strong encryption and compliance with industry standards.
B) Develop a custom payment system from scratch.
C) Use an outdated payment processing method to save costs.
D) Allow payments through unsecured channels to speed up the process.

Options: A) Simplifying the checkout process and reducing the number of steps.
B) Adding more advertisements on every page to increase revenue.
C) Removing navigation menus to make the site look cleaner.
D) Requiring users to sign in multiple times during a session for added security.

Questions.Text: The CEO asks you how you plan to ensure the platform is scalable as more users are added. What would you emphasize in your response?
Options: A) Building the platform with a modular architecture that can be easily scaled horizontally and vertically.
B) Designing the platform to handle a fixed number of users without the need for future upgrades.
C) Focusing on performance optimizations after the full launch.
D) Limiting the number of users allowed on the platform at any given time.
